sentence.Network_en: Community and church leaders have appealed for calm and no retaliation.
sentence.Network_cn: 社区和教会领袖呼吁各方保持冷静,不要采取报复行动.

sentence.Network_en: The armed forces were on high alert to guard against any retaliation.
sentence.Network_cn: 武装部队保持高度戒备，以防发生任何报复行动。
对联合国工作人员的报复

entry.def: If you retaliate when someone harms or annoys you, you do something which harms or annoys them in return.

example.ex: I was sorely tempted to retaliate...
Christie retaliated by sending his friend a long letter detailing Carl's utter incompetence...
example.tran: 为了报复，克里斯蒂给他朋友寄了一封长信，细述卡尔完全不称职。

means.word_mean: 1. action taken in return for an injury or offense

auth_sentence.content: She is saying "no" to crude retaliation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She is saying "no" to crude retaliation.

auth_sentence.content: She was apparently not above the most niggardly retaliation.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was apparently not above the most niggardly retaliation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was apparently not above the most niggardly retaliation.

auth_sentence.content: The first retaliation took place in the south-south.
auth_sentence.res_content: The first retaliation took place in the south-south.

means.word_mean: 报复；报仇 (~ against sb/sth for sth)

sentences.en: a casual remark that brought swift retaliation from her boyfriend
sentences.cn: 激起她男友迅速回击的随意的话

sentences.en: He never said a single word in retaliation.
sentences.cn: 他从未说过一句反击的话。
他们决定采取报复行动。

sentences.en: They killed two men in retaliation for a bomb attack the previous day.
sentences.cn: 为了报复前一天的炸弹袭击，他们杀死了两个人。
